message:
For those unfamiliar with spring and who don't get what I mean when I say Spring has it all. A few times I see people confusing C# and the .NET Framework comparing it to just plain Java language with it's base libraries. What would make more sense is understanding that each of these languages runs on an entire platform, which can talk to each other and inter-operate.  

So for those who would like to experience for themselves I share this list if guides.

http://spring.io/guides

I recommend with building a restful web service. All the tools, all the libraries and even the IDE is absolutely free and all of it is less that 800 MB :)
story: Muhammad Al Rabbani shared a link to the group: Egyptian Geeks.
name: Spring Guides
caption: spring.io
description: these guides are designed to get you productive as quickly as possible and using the latest Spring project releases and techniques as recommended by the Spring team
